Here's a link to the site - 
 
 http://www.soc.soton.ac.uk/soc_home2.php?pagetype=news3&idx=223
 
 If you have high speed, it's 36MB, download the PowerPoint presentation, it's incredible. Click where it says "click here" about half way down the page, then click on the seismic image at the top of the new page.
 
 Waxy

post_info.post_title: Seismic pics of seafloor in the area that generated the Tsunami

Very impressive, great info.
 
 Thanks for the link, Waxy. Got it saved to my hard drive.
 
 PP took awhile to download, but well worth it.

I see this stuff every day and it still blew me away.
 
 The scale of the rift zone and the erosion/faulting going on there is huge. Think Rocky Mountains combined with the Grand Canyon - all under a couple miles of water.
 
 Waxy
